Mike Foley wrote:

>Hi,
> 
>I have some JUnit/Cactus tests that I am converting to JUnitPerf timed and load tests.  The JUnit test deploys and undeploys in setUp() and tearDown().    For the JUnitPerf tests I only want setUp() to occur for the first user first iteration....and for tearDown() I only want to undeploy for last user last iteration.  How best to accomplish this?
> 
>I see on the JUnit FAQ about the RepeatedTest decorator.....because of limitations in my understanding of design patterns and that  we have extended JUnit classes I am not sure about this approach.
>  
>
You need the one just before that in the FAQ, namely the TestSetup. See
<http://jroller.com/page/raible/20040825#one_time_setup_with_testsetup> 
for an example.

>I have modified a base class we use and have set a protected variable...++ it in setUp()...and only do the work if this variable == 1.  And in tearDown() I -- it and again, only do the undeploy if this variable == 1.  Seems to work.
>
I don't see how this could work. The execution order is setup - test - 
teardown - setup - test - teardown - .... Every setup increments the 
variable, every teardown decrements the variable, so the variable would 
always be 0 when setup starts. You could fix it by somehow counting the 
number of tests (with reflection), not decrementing the variable, and do 
the actual teardown when the variable equals the number of tests. But I 
prefer the TestSetup.
